channel.title: Austin Delamar
channel.description: This is my blog about computers, programming, tech, and things that bother me. I hope it bothers you too.
channel.author: amdelamar

item.title: Fixing Akka Http "Substream Source cannot be materialized more than once" error
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Decided I'd share how I resolved this error with Akka Http client-side code when streaming large files.

item.title: Setting Up Your SSH & GPG Keys
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Here's a brief guide to setting up SSH & GPG Keys for git and secure messaging.

item.title: Scala CI-CD with Github Actions and Heroku
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: How to continuously run 'sbt test' on every PR, and after merging deploy it to Heroku.

item.title: Syntax Highlighting in Hugo with Markdown
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: A simple explanation about code highlighting in Markdown using Hugo.

item.title: Unit Testing Akka Http Client
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Unit testing Akka Http server API is well documented, but for some reason testing Akka Http client API is not documented nor straightforward.

item.title: Websockets With Akka Http
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: I didn't find a good example of Server Websockets with the latest version of Akka Http, so I made my own chatroom app.

item.title: Switching Gears
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Just an update about a few things that changed since my last post a year ago.

item.title: Continuous Learning at Work
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Take time to teach yourself something new every year, whether its a new language, build tool, IDE, framework, platform, or even soft skills like public speaking.

item.title: Alternatives to Google Products
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: An incomplete list of Google product alternatives that respect your privacy and data, or don't track your online activity.

item.title: Learn to Code Cloud-Native Apps for Free
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Developers can learn how to build apps using Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry and more. All without paying anything out of pocket.
